column3:
A: That restaurant is always full of people.
B: Yes, it {{c1::must}} be good.

A: That restaurant {{c1::can't}} be very good.
B: No, it's always empty.

A: I often see that man in this street.
B: So do I. I think he {{c1::must}} live near here.

A: Bill and Sue always stay in luxury hotels.
B: Yes, they {{c1::can't}} be short of money.

A: I think Ben is working today.
B: No, he {{c1::can't}} be working today. The office is closed.

A: I don't have the key. You {{c1::must}} have it.
B: No, I'm sure I gave it to you.

A: Will it take long to get to the airport?
B: No, it isn't very far. It {{c1::can't}} take more than 30 minutes.

A: How old is Ed?
B: Older than me. He {{c1::must}} be at least 40.
